DOCNAME: CASE OF SVETLANA ORLOVA v. RUSSIA
CONCLUSION: Remainder inadmissible;Violation of Art. 6-1;Non-pecuniary damage - award
JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Elisabeth Steiner;George Nicolaou;Giorgio Malinverni;Khanlar Hajiyev;Sverre Erik Jebens
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . The applicant worked in ORG ( “ ORG of the RA ” ) as a consultant . While she was on maternity leave her position was converted to that of assistant to the President of ORG . On her return the applicant was offered various posts , but not the newly created position of assistant to the President . She refused those offers and was dismissed .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a court action against ORG with ORG of the Republic of Adygeya ( “ the ORG ” ) . She requested ORG to reinstate her to her previous position , recover unpaid salary and award compensation for non - pecuniary damage . In the course of the proceedings the applicant amended her claims .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court fixed the first hearing for DATE . However , on that date the proceedings were postponed until DATE because the applicant and her child were sick .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant requested ORG to postpone the examination of the case until her request to have the case referred to a different court had been examined by a higher court . She also objected to CARDINAL of the judges sitting in the case .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed her request and the objection to the judge and rejected her claims as unsubstantiated .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld that judgment .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE ( “ the ORG ” ) , following a request for supervisory review by the Deputy Prosecutor General of GPE , found that the lower courts had erroneously interpreted the substantive law . On those grounds it quashed the judgment of DATE , as upheld on DATE , and remitted the case to ORG for a fresh examination .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG fixed the hearing for CARDINAL DATE . However , on that date the proceedings were postponed , at the applicant ’s request , until ORG had examined her request to have the case referred to a different court .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG replied to the applicant that there were no grounds to refer her case to a different court .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , after a fresh examination , found that the applicant ’s dismissal had been unlawful , ordered ORG to reinstate the applicant to her position , pay her salary arrears and compensation for non - pecuniary damage . ORG of the ORG appealed against the judgment of DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant requested ORG to refer her case to a different appeal court on the ground that the judges of ORG of the ORG should not examine an appeal lodged by ORG . That would amount to a violation of her right to an independent and impartial tribunal . On DATE the applicant lodged an objection to all the judges of ORG and requested that the appeal not be examined until ORG had replied .

CARDINAL . NORP However , on DATE ORG of the GPE heard the case on appeal and found , in particular , that ORG had not properly established the facts of the case . It quashed the judgment of CARDINAL DATE and remitted the case to ORG for a fresh examination .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG informed the applicant that her request that the appeal be heard by a different appeal court could not be examined as ORG of the ORG had already held an appeal hearing , on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , after a fresh examination , dismissed the applicant ’s claims as unsubstantiated . The applicant appealed .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant requested ORG of GPE to refer her appeal against the judgment of DATE to a different appeal court in order to have her case heard by an impartial and independent tribunal . She requested ORG to order ORG to postpone the appeal proceedings until its decision on her request .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of the ORG upheld the judgment of DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG informed the applicant that her request for her appeal to be referred to a different court could not be examined , as ORG of the ORG had already examined her appeal , on DATE . It further noted that it was open for her to contest the decisions adopted in her case by lodging an application for supervisory review of those decisions .

CARDINAL . In DATE and DATE the applicant attempted to obtain the re - opening of the proceedings by way of supervisory review . However , ORG of the ORG and ORG of the Russian Federation either refused to refer the case to the supervisory review court for examination on the merits or refused to examine her applications on procedural grounds .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant again applied for the re - opening of the proceedings . On DATE a judge of ORG of GPE referred the case to ORG of ORG of GPE for examination on the merits .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE , acting by way of supervisory review , found that there had been serious procedural breaches in the examination of the applicant ’s case . In particular , it found that ORG of the ORG , who was a defendant in the case , had been directly interested in the outcome of the proceedings and thus there were doubts as to its objectiveness and impartiality . ORG of the ORG was also a superior court to ORG and could therefore give instructions to ORG . In such circumstances , the case should have been referred to a different court . ORG pointed out that on numerous occasions the applicant had lodged objections to judges of ORG and of ORG and had requested to have her case referred to a different court . All her requests had been dismissed .

ORG concluded that the judgment of DATE , as upheld on DATE , was unlawful and had to be quashed . It further held that the case had to be examined anew by a court situated in a different region and referred the case to ORG of Krasnodar ( “ the ORG ” ) .
CARDINAL . ORG fixed the first hearing on DATE . However , on that date the proceedings were adjourned because the defendant did not attend the hearing .
CARDINAL . In DATE the defendant made several requests to the applicant ’s new employers concerning the periods of her employment with them and positions occupied .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG examined the applicant ’s claim and found that she had abused her rights when she had refused to accept the positions offered to her in ORG , and dismissed her claims .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( “ the Regional Court ” ) upheld that judgment .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Presidium of ORG examined an application by ORG for supervisory review of the decisions adopted in the applicant ’s case . The ORG held that it was the applicant ’s right to refuse positions with a lower salary and that it could not be considered an abuse of rights . It also pointed out that the dismissal on an employer ’s initiative of women with children DATE was forbidden by LAW ( see “ Relevant Domestic Law ” below , § CARDINAL ) , unless the enterprise had been fully liquidated . Since ORG of the ORG had not been liquidated , the dismissal of the applicant , who had a small child , had been unlawful and unacceptable .
The ORG quashed the judgment of DATE , as upheld on CARDINAL April DATE , and remitted the case to ORG for a fresh examination .

CARDINAL . On DATE , after a fresh examination , ORG dismissed the applicant ’s claim in the part concerning her reinstatement . It granted her claim in the part relating to compensation for pecuniary and non - pecuniary damage .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG examined appeals by the applicant and the prosecutor against the judgment of DATE , found that the judgment was unlawful and quashed it . The court held that since the applicant ’s claims for compensation for pecuniary and non - pecuniary damage were closely linked with her claim for reinstatement , the relevant circumstances could not be established by the appeal court and it was necessary to refer the case to ORG for a fresh examination .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG examined the case anew and found that the applicant ’s dismissal had been unlawful . It ordered that the applicant be reinstated to her position and recovered in her favour MONEY ( RUB ) in respect of unpaid salary . It dismissed her claims for compensation for non - pecuniary damage . The judgment acquired legal force on DATE .

CARDINAL . By a decision of CARDINAL DATE ORG corrected an error in the judgment of DATE and held that the defendant had to pay the applicant RUB CARDINAL in salary arrears . That decision became final on CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . Russian Labour Code , which was in force until DATE , provided in Article CARDINAL that the dismissal on an employer ’s initiative of women with children DATE was forbidden , unless the enterprise had been fully liquidated .
